name: Poet
ability: You start knowing an in-play role and a variant of its ability. Once per game, you may change all instances of that role's ability to the variant. All affected players learn their new ability when this happens.
otherNightReminder: If the Poet has not yet used their ability, they may wake. The Poet points to a character token. Modify one word of that character's ability (add, remove, or change). Show the affected player the 'You are' card and their character token, then show them the modified ability written down. If the change is problematic, you may wake the Poet again to choose differently.

name: Monster
ability: You have a Minion ability and an Outsider ability, and you start knowing these.
firstNightReminder: Show the Monster the 'You are' card, then a Minion token and an Outsider token. Mark the Monster with the 'Minion Ability' and 'Outsider Ability' reminders to track which abilities they have.

jinxes.reason: The Monster does not start knowing their abilities if they have the Lunatic ability.
A Monster-Marionette has no Marionette ability & the Marionette is in play.

name: Spite
ability: You start knowing a player. You are mad they are evil or one or both of you might die. If you die by execution, you become their alignment.
firstNightReminder: Point to a player. The Spite must be mad that this player is evil, or risk execution.

name: Tattered
ability: Each night*, choose a player: they die. The first living player that publicly claimed a character that day is mad that they are that character tomorrow, or might be executed.
otherNightReminder: The Tattered points to a player. That player dies. Mark the first living player who publicly claimed a character today with the 'Mad' reminder. They must be mad that they are that character, or risk execution.

jinxes.reason: Cerenovus madness and Tattered madness are indistinguishable.
